title: Getting Started with Test Optimization
description: NEW! Accelerate your CI pipelines by implementing Datadog Test Optimization. Set up test monitoring, identify flaky tests, and leverage Test Impact Analysis to run only the tests that matter.

title: Send AWS Logs to Datadog
description: NEW: Learn to centralize AWS logs in Datadog. Configure Amazon Data Firehose, Lambda Forwarder, Datadog Agent, Lambda Extension, and FluentBit to collect logs from VPC, CloudTrail, ALB, EC2, Lambda, and ECS Fargate services.

title: Getting Started with Observability in Google Cloud with Datadog
description: NEW! Install Datadog’s Google Cloud integration and configure log collection with Google Cloud Dataflow using Terraform. Install the Datadog Agent on a Compute Engine VM instance using Google Cloud's SSH-in-browser.

title: Getting Started with Kubernetes Observability
description: Simplify Kubernetes observability with Datadog. Navigate the Kubernetes Explorer, analyze pod details, and diagnose cluster issues using metrics and events.

title: Optimize Frontend Performance with Datadog RUM Browser Monitoring
description: Understand your web application’s user experience, prioritize and troubleshoot performance issues, and track Core Web Vitals with Datadog RUM Browser Monitoring.

title: Getting Started with Notebooks
description: Create Datadog Notebooks to investigate incidents. Add logs, metrics, and SLO data to analyze system issues. Document findings with markdown and visualizations. Configure sharing permissions and export notebooks for team collaboration.

title: Automating Meaningful Actions with Datadog Workflow Automation
description: NEW! Learn how to automate security responses and operational remediation using Datadog Workflow Automation, from rolling back faulty deployments to maintaining tag hygiene and fixing cloud misconfigurations.

title: Configure AWS Lambda for Serverless Monitoring with Datadog
description: Integrate Datadog with AWS Lambda to monitor performance, trace requests, and quickly diagnose errors, cold starts, and latency issues.

title: Tracing LLM Applications
description: Trace key operations for end-to-end-visibility in multi-step pipelines. Visualize execution flows in complex LLM chains. Debug failures and understand model behavior using detailed traces, contextual annotations, and performance metrics.

title: Configuring Single Step Instrumentation on Kubernetes
description: Accelerate APM instrumentation time of your application in Kubernetes without editing code.

title: Getting Started with LLM Observability
description: Build observability into an LLM application. Monitor LLM performance and costs. Explore trace data with prompt inputs and response outputs. Analyze token usage and latency metrics. Identify errors and discover root causes.

title: Build Self-Serve Apps with App Builder for Third-Party Integrations
description: Learn how to build a Datadog App Builder app that interacts with GitHub. Use tables, modals, and forms to create issues, list pull requests (PRs), and post comments on the PRs–all from your app.

title: Getting Started with App Builder
description: Learn the basics of App Builder by creating an app using a blueprint. Set up a connection, add actions and components, and explore how App Builder helps teams take action directly from Datadog.

title: Troubleshooting APM Instrumentation on a Host
description: In this course, you’ll deepen your knowledge of APM and learn how to troubleshoot issues that are blocking trace data from reaching Datadog. You’ll diagnose problems within an application running on a host monitored by the Datadog Agent.

title: Getting Started with Universal Service Monitoring (USM)
description: Automatically detect, map, manage, and monitor services in your environment with Datadog’s Universal Service Monitoring and Software Catalog—no code-level instrumentation required!

title: Detect Web Application Attacks with App & API Protection
description: Detect common attacks against a vulnerable web application using Datadog Application & API Protection. Configure App & API Protection for your services and create a custom detection rule to enhance your defenses.

title: Block Application Attacks with Application & API Protection
description: Block application attacks using Datadog Application & API Protection. Use the In-App WAF and Denylist to block suspicious IP addresses and requests. Add user information and custom business logic to traces and block malicious users.

title: Enable and Manage Workload Protection
description: Enable Workload Protection for your cloud workloads and detect infrastructure threats in real time. Manage out-of-the-box Security Agent rules and detection rules to customize Workload Protection for your environment.

title: Detect Host and Container Compromises with Workload Protection
description: Monitor file, network, process, and kernel activity with Workload Protection. Detect and investigate intrusions and running malware in real-time. Secure containerized and host-based workloads.

title: Automate Threat Investigation and Remediation with Security Workflows
description: Automate security investigation and remediation tasks with Datadog Workflow Automation and Cloud SIEM. Create security workflows using Cloud SIEM Content Packs and SOAR blueprints. Automate threat remediation in AWS using security workflows.

title: Write Secure Code with Datadog Code Security
description: Implement DevSecOps best practices and write secure code with Datadog Code Security.  Use Static Code Analysis (SAST) and Software Composition Analysis (SCA) to prevent security vulnerabilities from reaching your production environment.

title: Enhance Log Querying and Analytics with Reference Tables, Subqueries, and Calculated Fields
description: Combine metadata with your logs using Reference Tables. Filter one set of logs against another set of logs using Subqueries. Create new fields using existing tags and attributes at query time using Calculated Fields.

title: Dive Deeper into Log Queries and Aggregations
description: Create visualizations for counts and statistics of log attributes. Build multiple queries and formulas. Use functions to transform data in visualizations. Aggregate logs based on patterns and transactions (related sequences of events).

title: Getting Started with Service Level Objectives (SLOs)
description: In this course, you’ll deepen your understanding of Service Level Objectives (SLOs) and gain hands-on experience using them to solve issues in a web application. This builds on the concepts covered in Understanding Service Level Objectives.

title: Getting Started with Infrastructure and Cloud Network Monitoring
description: Learn how to analyze metrics, visualize network and infrastructure performance, and troubleshoot issues effectively in this introduction to using Datadog’s Infrastructure and Cloud Network Monitoring (CNM).

title: Creating Custom Metrics with DogStatsD
description: Use DogStatsD to create custom metrics for your applications that track business outcomes, internal information, and more. Set up, send, and view these metrics in Datadog.

title: Getting Started with Integrations
description: Learn how Datadog’s 800+ integrations collect and report data from an expansive list of outside tools, platforms, programming languages, and more.

title: Getting Started with Metrics
description: Explore metric types, origins, and their role in monitoring. Practice querying, aggregating, and visualizing metrics to effectively track systems over time, establish baselines, identify patterns, and more.

title: Understanding Service Level Objectives (SLOs)
description: In this course, you’ll learn how to create, configure, and apply Service Level Objectives (SLOs) in Datadog to monitor the health and performance of your services. SLOs are critical for defining the expected reliability of your applications.

title: Getting Started with Monitors
description: Create, configure, and use Datadog Monitors to stay ahead of issues. Explore various monitor types and examine the monitor status page to detect issues early and keep systems running smoothly.

title: Advanced Log Configuration
description: Configure your logs to filter out sensitive data, gain support for multi-line logging, and apply global processing rules to get the most out of your logs. Solve common problems in configuring logs for a production application.

title: Diagnosing Application Bugs with Datadog APM
description: Leverage several features of the Datadog APM product to identify bugs within application code. Using insights gained from APM, fix those bugs and verify your fixes have made a difference in stability and performance.

title: Understanding OpenTelemetry
description: Discover the fundamentals of OpenTelemetry (OTel), an open-source standard for telemetry data collection. This course provides an overview of OTel's capabilities and benefits, preparing you for integrating observability into your applications.

title: Getting Started with APM Metrics & Traces
description: Monitor service health and performance with Application Performance Management. Explore traces to understand requests and interactions between services. Track key metrics to understand trends that impact system behavior and user experience.

title: Discovering Table, List, SLO, and Architecture Widgets
description: In this course, you’ll learn how to create, configure, and utilize Datadog dashboard table, list, SLO, and architecture widgets. You’ll track the metrics and performance of a web application and discover how to present important data.

title: APM Rate Limiting and Retention
description: Control APM trace retention and rate limiting for your applications. Add ingestion and retention filters, create metrics from traces, and monitor trace usage to better manage your APM data.

title: Getting Started with Synthetic Monitoring and Browser Testing
description: Simulate user sessions to proactively test and monitor applications from different locations, browsers, and devices.

title: Customize Alert Monitor Notifications
description: Craft dynamic and descriptive notification messages for alert monitors using conditional, tag, and template variables. In the hands-on lab, you’ll gain practical experience by drafting and testing notification messages.

title: Track Logs for Alerting and Investigations
description: Set up alerts for logs using Log Monitors. Investigate error logs using Error Tracking. Create metrics from logs using Generate Metrics. Visualize log data in Dashboards alongside related data and insights.

title: Getting Started with Log Explorer
description: Query logs from all of your log sources. Investigate log details. Build visualizations with Fields Aggregations. Create Saved Views. Add facets and measures.

title: Monitor a Kafka Pipeline with DSM
description: Learn to monitor Kafka pipelines with Data Streams Monitoring, a powerful tool for effectively overseeing your data-driven applications.

title: Introduction to OpenTelemetry with Datadog
description: Configure your OpenTelemetry (OTel) instrumented system so that you can explore OTel-collected metrics, traces, and logs all in Datadog.

title: Discovering Graph Widgets
description: In this course, you’ll learn how to create, configure, and utilize Datadog dashboard graph widgets. You’ll track the metrics and performance of a web application and discover how to present important data using these popular widget types.

title: Set up APM for Java applications on a host
description: Set up Datadog Application Performance Monitoring (APM) for Java applications running on a host. Apply recommended practices and build confidence when adding APM to your applications.

title: Monitoring a Kubernetes Cluster: Troubleshooting Workloads
description: This course will present hands-on scenarios in which you will use Datadog to identify, fix, and monitor common Kubernetes workload issues.

title: APM Monitors and Alerting
description: Learn to create and modify effective APM monitors and alerts so your systems are properly monitored and the correct teams notified when something goes wrong.

title: Remediate Issues with Workflow Automation
description: Automate redundant, time-sensitive processes. Create workflows from scratch or using blueprints. Configure actions to automate tasks and communicate with teams and third-party services.

title: Monitoring a Kubernetes Cluster: The Control Plane
description: This course will walk you through monitoring each of a Kubernetes cluster's control plane components: API Server, Controller Manager, Scheduler, and etcd.

title: Configure Log Collection for a Containerized Application
description: Learn how to set up logging and log ingestion for an app that is built with Ruby and Python services in a Docker environment. The concepts are applicable to other languages, frameworks, and environments.

title: Manage and Monitor Indexed Log Volumes
description: Control and track retention and volumes of indexed logs to maintain costs using Indexes with Exclusion Filters, Logs Monitors, and the Log Management - Estimated Usage dashboard. Learn about Flex Logs vs Standard Indexing.

title: Configure Cloud SIEM for AWS
description: Secure your cloud environments with Datadog Cloud SIEM. Enable Cloud SIEM, ingest cloud audit logs, and install a Content Pack. The lab and examples in this course feature AWS. The concepts are applicable to multiple cloud providers.

title: Detect and Investigate Threats with Cloud SIEM
description: Secure your cloud environments with Datadog Cloud SIEM and cloud provider Content Packs. Explore out-of-the-box threat detection rules. Investigate incoming threats using Security Signals, Signals Explorer, and Cloud SIEM Investigator.

title: Introduction to Real User Monitoring (RUM)
description: How does your user experience impact operational success? Use data from real end-users to track UX, performance, deployments, and errors—all while gaining visibility into precisely how users interact with your apps.

title: Database Monitoring Quiz
description: Are you intrigued by exploring your understanding of Database Monitoring (DBM)? This quiz serves as an excellent opportunity to assess your comprehension of DBM, offering a foundation for further exploration and learning.

title: Introduction to Dashboards
description: In this course, you’ll learn how to create Datadog dashboards that display the status and performance of a web application. You’ll track the site's performance and error rate and present this data in a way that is easy to understand.

title: Tracking errors with RUM for JavaScript web applications
description: Learn how to use the error tracking features of Datadog Real User Monitoring (RUM) on your JavaScript web applications.

title: Process Logs Out of the Box with Integration Pipelines
description: Structure and enrich ingested logs from common sources using out-of-the-box and modified Integration Pipelines.

title: Build and Manage Log Pipelines
description: Build a log pipeline from scratch. Use the Pipeline Scanner to check if the pipeline is processing the logs as expected. Add a Standard Attribute for a common attribute in logs.

title: Create Custom Spans and Span Tags with APM
description: Learn how to create custom spans, create tags for those spans, and create measures from tags to surface data and troubleshoot issues with Datadog APM.

title: Find and Remediate Vulnerable Cloud Resources with Cloud Security Misconfigurations
description: Secure your cloud environments with Datadog Cloud Security. Learn how to deploy and configure misconfiguration scanning across your entire cloud infrastructure. Use Compliance to assess your security posture against industry-standard frameworks.

title: Collect Custom Data with RUM for JavaScript Web Applications
description:
Learn how to use Datadog Real User Monitoring (RUM) to collect custom
data from your JavaScript web applications.

title: Monitoring a Kubernetes Cluster: Install the Agent
description: To monitor your Kubernetes cluster with Datadog, you must install the Datadog Agent. This course will walk you through the most common ways of installing Cluster and Node Agents on Kubernetes: the Helm chart and The Datadog Operator.

title: Managing Services with the Software Catalog
description: Understand the Datadog Software Catalog. Create and modify useful metadata with service definitions.

title: Optimize Request Latency with Profiling Timeline
description: Pinpoint causes of poor request latency using Timeline in Continuous Profiler. View the distribution of thread activity and runtime activity over every request for full visibility into multithreaded applications.

title: Create Business-Critical Insights Using Dashboards and SLOs
description: In this course you’ll learn techniques for creating an executive Dashboard that shows a mix of Powerpacks and widgets. You'll track business objectives, application uptime, and system performance while presenting this data in a Dashboard.

title: The Agent on a Host
description: Introduction to running the Datadog Agent on a host. Hands-on activities walk you through running and configuring the Agent to collect events, metrics, and logs from other services.

title: The Agent on Docker
description: Introduction to running the Datadog Agent in a container. Hands-on activities walk you through running and configuring the Agent container to collect metrics and logs from other services.

title: Datadog Quick Start
description: Explore data and insights in Dashboards, Logs, Software Catalog, and Monitors for a live application environment. Become confident finding your way around Datadog features you'll use everyday.

title: Introduction to Monitoring AWS
description: This course will walk you through a series of hands-on exercises, including installing the integration and installing sub-integrations for specific services, such as AWS Lambda and Amazon RDS.

title: Configure Real User Monitoring (RUM) for JavaScript web applications
description: Learn about the different configuration options when setting up Datadog RUM on your JavaScript web applications.

title: Introduction to Observability
description: What is observability? This question needs to be answered before you start using the Datadog platform. In this introductory course we’ll cover the three pillars of observability and prepare you to move on to our Datadog Foundation training.

title: Monitoring a Postgres Database with Datadog DBM
description: Identify inefficiencies and optimize your database. View query metrics, explain plans, and visualizations from all of your databases in a single place.

title: The Learning Environment
description: This course, a prerequisite for all Learning Center courses and workshops, sets you up in the learning environment and helps you get comfortable with its various controls and screens.

title: Tagging Best Practices
description: Develop an effective tagging strategy to improve data organization and visibility across your systems. Filter, group, and explore correlated data with tags in Datadog for deeper insights into performance, resource usage, and application behavior.

title: Create an Agent Integration
description: This course guides you through the development process for a sample Datadog integration, presenting the associated tooling along with the coding and configuration steps, all with a view to helping you start building your own integrations.

title: Diagnose Code Performance Issues with Continuous Profiler
description: Investigate and improve application code performance in production with Datadog Continuous Profiler.

title: Synthetic Tests in a CI/CD Pipeline
description: In this course, you learn how to incorporate Datadog's synthetic tests into a CI/CD pipeline to help you catch bugs in code before deployment.

title: Introduction to Cloud SIEM
description: In this course, you learn the fundamentals about how to use Cloud SIEM in Datadog to detect different types of security threats and attacks.

title: Introduction to Incident Management
description: In this course, you learn about managing incidents by working through a hands-on example with Datadog Incident Management. You also learn how to use Slack to effectively communicate incident status to your team.

title: Datadog API: Automation and Infrastructure as Code
description: In this course, you'll take a hands-on tour of the Datadog API and its capabilities. You'll also learn a variety of ways to communicate with the Datadog API, with an emphasis on automated methods.

title: Using Datadog Notebooks for Centralized Reporting
description: In this lab, you learn how to use Datadog and the Datadog API to build a notebook that holds, over a 5-day span, both metric data and software release notes for an application.

title: Tracking Canary Deployments with Datadog
description: In this lab, you use Datadog’s deployment tracking together with Docker to deploy, track, and remediate issues within staged releases.
